1300186.text: A stone statue that quietly guards the periphery of Chrono Tower. Once it senses someone approaching, it will send out a destructive light to attack the stranger.

1300187.text: The guard at the bottom of the Chrono Tower. Manipulated by magic, he attacks any intruders on sight.

1300188.text: A bat that waits for the blood of creatures in the darkness.

1300189.text: A book that records the rudimentary conjuring of thunder.

1300190.text: A bat that has not reached full maturity. It lies in wait for unsuspecting creatures in the dark.

1300191.text: A demon with deep jealousy, deluding herself that all are conquered by her charms.

1300192.text: The arch-wraith in the tower. Its appearance alone invokes terror in those who lay sight on it.

1300193.text: The watcher who was ordered to guard the Dimensional Tunnel.

1300198.text: A pink plant capable of continuously firing thistles.

1300199.text: A mutant plant capable of continuously firing thistles.

1300200.text: A mushroom whose spores are filled with dangerous toxins that can quickly paralyze people.

1300201.text: A cyan mushroom that shuns strangers.

1300202.text: A green mushroom that has been robbed of its sanity by magic.

1300203.text: A ferocious monster with a body like a pine tree.

1300204.text: A vicious monster with the appearance of a blossoming tree.

1300209.text: A pine cone-shaped monster. Travelers are often deceived by its appearance.

1300210.text: A monster that uses a long horn to attack enemies.

1300211.text: A stone-made giant. Manipulated by runic magic, it has incredible power.

1300212.text: A higher predator that can camouflage in orchids.

1300213.text: A higher predator corrupted by the Magic of the Liminal Field, with a different appearance from other mantises.

1300214.text: Used to be a very narcissistic singer, who later transformed into the appearance of a sunflower after being contaminated by magic.

1300215.text: The priest serving the Protector of Irminsul. After the Abnormality, her faith collapsed and her sanity lost due to the metamorphosis, leaving her with only the obsession of protecting the inhabitants.

1300216.text: The Protector of Irminsul who first sensed the world's ongoing collapse and became obsessed with magical research in an attempt to stop the scourge. However, the magic leaked out and caused the tragedy of Irminsul.

1300217.text: Floating with the wind, and reconciled to the world.

1300218.text: An evil monster cursing its foes with powerful conjuring.

1300220.text: A huge rat that is very aggressive.

1300221.text: A rat still in its infancy.

1300222.text: A follower of the Protector of Chronospace has spent many years within the walls of the Chrono Tower.

1300223.text: A seeming champion of justice who tries to cleanse evil with elemental magic but this skillful intruder of the Chrono Tower likely has ulterior motives.

1300224.text: A wolf still in its infancy.

1300225.text: The best hunter in the snowlands, well adapted to the harsh environment.

1300226.text: A beast that can easily tear apart its prey.

1300227.text: A tree-shaped monster that has gone berserk after being affected by frost magic.

1300228.text: A vigorous hunter looking for a new prey in the snowlands.

1300229.text: Subordinate of Silverbow, who's forthright but often commits blunders due to the impulsiveness.

1300230.text: The top hunter in the wolf pack. No prey can escape its clutches.

1300231.text: Humanoid evil spirit that manipulates cold air.

1300232.text: An anomaly covered with ice magic.

1300233.text: An anomaly that has absorbed little ice magic.

1300234.text: A ferocious monster covered with thick fur.

1300235.text: Manipulated by the ice crystal core, this giant golem repels any intruders.

1300236.text: A sentry of the Frost Chivalric Order, loyal to the Saintess.

1300237.text: A guard of the Frost Chivalric Order, loyal to the Saintess.

1300238.text: The sentry captain of the Frost Chivalric Order who directs the sentries to fulfill the orders of their superiors.

1300239.text: The guard captain of the Frost Chivalric Order who directs the guards to fulfill the orders of their superiors.

1300240.text: The captain of the Chivalric Order, proficient in swordplay and advanced magic, holds absolute loyalty to the Saintess.

1300241.text: A fierce white bear. As a mount, it is directly subservient to its master Cersivey, the Saintess.

1300242.text: She's the supreme ruler of the ice world Snegurochka and the Saintess revered by chevaliers. She lives in the castle atop the mountain, away from crowds, which makes her a cold and ruthless beauty.

1300243.text: When fighting on her mount with all her might, Cersivey is cold and ruthless.

1300244.text: A book that records the rudimentary Conjuring of Earth.

1300245.text: An ethereal form with evil energy lingering around it.

1300246.text: A wraith formed by the aggregation of deep resentment in the tower. Any creature can be its target.

1300247.text: Resentful spirits of the sorcerers who died when venturing too deep into the tower. They are obsessed with rebirth.

1300248.text: A completely ossified serpent, whose giant body can be driven only by magic.

1300249.text: Used to be the deliverer of the Underworld, who afterwards signed a contract with a demon for some unknown purpose.

1300250.text: Treats everyone else as a hindrance after being controlled by forbidden magic.

1300251.text: A flying creature capable of using frost magic.

1300252.text: A ferocious monster with orchids sprouting from his head.

1300253.text: A one-horned creature showing dogged vitality in the icy lands.

1300254.text: Affected by frost magic, the mushroom attacks humans indiscriminately.

1300255.text: A magical spirit born in lava.

1300256.text: A flaming monster that was once sealed by freezing magic.

1300257.text: A monster that casts fire magic.

1300258.text: A huge golem made of lava, with extraordinary destructive power.

1300259.text: The vice captain of the Frost Chivalric Order who is controlled by others after losing sanity.

1300260.text: The former follower of Ereshkigal, the Protector of Chronospace. Tries to harness the energy of geothermal heat.

1300261.text: A book that records the rudimentary Conjuring of Fire.

1300262.text: A book that records the rudimentary Conjuring of Water.

1300263.text: Disguised as a treasure chest, the monster adapts to various environments.

1300428.text:
She was an orphan brought up in the Belgica Convent. As a child, she was often bullied by others, including the mother superior of the Convent. 

No one was willing to step forward to help Croche, she could only shed her tears alone in a hidden corner. 

The convent belfry often sent strange sounds into the night and was feared to be haunted. 

Therefore she was assigned to ring the bell of the belfry everyday. 

Night by night, she would climb to the top with her lamp and ring the bell alone.

1300429.text:
However, people eventually realized that this young girl was no longer the child who used to sob in the corner. 

An unholy aura surrounded her so that no one dared to approach her. People started spreading rumors that this young girl seemed to have made a pact with the demon in the belfry.

1300430.text:
She did make a pact but she was not fully obedient to the demon. 

She used the demon's power stored in the lamp to heal the pain, rather than hurting others.

1300431.text:
She, having been bullied, could only cry alone at night on the top of the belfry, which awakened the demon that was sleeping in the darkness. 

The demon reached out to her and offered its power, the genuineness of which made her feel warm and secure. 

Though she received the power, she still possessed self-awareness, 
not always following the demon's order. 

Thus the demon inflicted physical misery on her as a punishment, which made her skin paler, bit by bit. 

To hide her morbid body, she wrapped thick bandages around her legs.

1300432.text:
She's a young girl from the western island, born to the Olíndic family. Her elder sister Yui is the heir of the family and as such inherited the position of Ovate, taking charge of the "Anam (Soul)". 

As a member of the Olíndic family, Miku also possesses the power of the Legendary Beast, yet the uncertainty of this power makes her feel scared and hide behind her sister without talking to anyone for a long time. 

To show her great admiration for her sister, she chooses to wield the same weapon of spear as her sister does.

1300433.text:
In a family of Six Ovates, only one could inherit the position of Ovate. After Yui becomes the Ovate, Miku has to leave the island to train elsewhere. 

There is no bloody struggle for the position as is common for successors in other families. 

Miku wishes her sister well and is determined that one day she will return and guard the land together with Yui.

1300434.text:
Unlike her sister who focuses on combat, Miku prefers the art of cooking and can use all kinds of ingredients to concoct delicious dishes. 

She's not conceited about her culinary pursuits, but hopes that her efforts can be recognized by her sister. 

She is very shy with strangers, but also considerate of others. 

She cares a lot about her appearance, though she would never admit it. She is said to have been secretly imitating her sister's fashion sense and makeup. 

Miku may appear cute, but her strength can never be underestimated - the bloodline of Olíndic enables her to tear apart hostile intruders with ease by manipulating the Legendary Beast.

1300435.text:
Besides her sister, Yothaya is the only friend that Miku can have fun with carefreely. 

Both of them are fond of cooking and often enter the forest to search for all kinds of ingredients.
The apples on the tree, the mushrooms in a haystack, everything can be the inspiration to their new dishes. 

Since Yothaya is still learning to cook, she often creates strange dishes that are hard to swallow. However, Miku always forces herself to eat up all with her nose pinched.

1300436.text:
As the youngest princess of the Principality of Lunia, she is the jewel of the Grand Duke of Lunia but she has never developed an arrogant attitude due to her position. 

Instead, she treats people around her gently, regardless of their status. 

Whenever she uses her healing magic to help others, her smile always heals more than her magic.

1300437.text:
She is a kind princess who is not willing to harm anyone but she's also unexpectedly forthright and sincere. 

She believes that God will always bless the land of Lunia and guide her people out of the suffering of war, and that with God's help, a kingdom where all people live equally can be built one day.

1300438.text:
In order to escape from a political marriage, she gave up her noble status, and fled the palace to become a nun dedicated to God. 

From then on, Eulalia travels the lands just to help the civilians who suffer from wars. 

Her compassion has been called the salvation of God, for which the title of Saintess of Lunia was born. 

Even touble-makers like Cynetia can be accepted by her wholeheartedly.

1300439.text:
There are times that she reminisces on those old days, and before retiring for the night, she will take out her exquisite garments from the bottom of the box, and with a happy smile on her face, holds them tightly in her arms, losing herself in ages past. 

This scene was once seen by Mortimer, who then started to take Eulalia to the clothing shop. 

The same taste for the cute garments has finally made them inseparable friends.

1300440.text: This gorgeous girl is known as Rumni's topmost dancer. $B$Her dances will even attract butterflies to flutter around her. $B$$B$No one knows this girl's origin though. $B$$B$Both nobles and commoners yearn for the slightest glimpse of her dance.

1300441.text: Her nobility shows in every gesture. $B$Maybe she was born in a noble family$B$$B$ but this is a topic she seems not to be willing to talk about. $B$Once someone mentions that, she will stop talking and leave immediately. $B$$B$Yet, being wilful also constitutes a part of her charm.

1300442.text: Vedare is not only a favorite of the upper class, $B$but also a down-to-earth dancer who graces the city streets, charming passers-by. $B$$B$According to herself, she seems not to like the nobles $B$but prefers to visit the towns and villages to dance for the common people.

1300443.text: She has an extraordinary passion for dance and a desire for the strong. $B$$B$If you are strong enough to win her admiration, $B$she'd be happy to join your team and offer you a beautiful dance of blessing. $B$$B$But before that, $B$you will be challenged to dance with her to test whether you can keep up.

1300444.text:
Born in the Lower Domain of Cassiel, she grew up as an orphan on the streets. 

To survive, she joined a crime syndicate, did a lot of dirty work, and honed her top-notch assassin skills in the grimmest nooks of the city.

1300445.text:
The nobles valued her prowess so much that they took her in and entrusted her with numerous assassination quests, which she never failed. 

No one on the hit list could escape the reach of this fearsome girl, aka the Deathbringer.

1300446.text: After vanishing for a period, she was discovered to have broken away from the control of the nobility and joined the Alliance of the Rebellions in Lower Domain, becoming the most trusted companion of its leader.

1300447.text:
In the Alliance, she serves as the leader's guard. 

Her previous assassination experience helps devise an impeccable security plan for the leader, 

who relies upon her for her composure in all circumstances.

1300448.text:
She is a vampire noble who lives in an abandoned castle. 

She looks young, but her actual age may be closer to one thousand years. 

No one dares to approach her, not to mention asking her age.

1300449.text:
Deemed by the Church as the oldest bloodsucker, she neither grows nor ages. 

She only comes out of the castle at night and appears in the Mistforest. 

No creature dares to come near when she is walking alone. 

When her strength reaches its peak on the night of the full moon, her urge to suck blood can no longer be suppressed, and her spirit can be so unstable that she will destroy all creatures in her path by feeding on every drop of their blood. 

Since she is aware of this, she tries to avoid going out at night on the full moon.

1300450.text:
She attaches great importance to her aristocratic decency, as is shown in her gorgeous clothes and elegant manners, 

but she's still naive like a child. As long as you don't mess with her, you won't be in great danger.

Unlike other lower bloodsuckers, she won't attack any creature first unless she's provoked first. 

Eccentric as she is, 
she gets along very well with Ella and Metamorphoses and often goes out to play with them. 

Unlike Ella, Nocturna is careful and sensitive to the slight mood changes of Metamorphoses.

1300451.text:
After eating an apple brought by Ella, she became obsessed with its sweet and sour taste. She tried to buy fruit in the market of the town but people there just ran off screaming when saw her. 

She felt so irritated that she brought Metamorphoses along and sneaked into the town to feast in the fruit warehouse. 

Though she met with the opposition from Metamorphoses, she could care less because nothing was more important than having tasty apples. 

However, out of respect for Metamorphoses' feeling, she decided to stop sneaking. Instead, she asked Ella who can freely go to the human town to help her buy apples.

1300452.text:
She is a sorcerer who only exists in stories, and it is said that she was involved in the start of the Eternal Winter. But no records exist from so far back, so it can't be proved. 

She lost a normal body as a human and remains forever in a small body size in exchange for using advanced magic. 

She seems to be very sensitive about this matter, and once someone mentions it, she will immediately see it as ridicule and provocation.

1300453.text:
She can easily throw a temper tantrum when something doesn’t go according to her wishes. 

Even if others are more than careful when talking to her, she still can be easily angered. 

She has the mind of a child, so unpredictable that she can lose her temper at any time and treat everything around as a vent to her anger. 

Hence, better be prepared, otherwise staying away from her is a better choice.

1300454.text:
She often appears by the lake in Landnama. With a pair of ice wings, she can be easily recognized. 

People in Landnama will turn away the moment they catch sight of her in the distance, for fear of being her punching bag. 

Sometimes she sleeps on the lake, with the water around frozen immediately and even the lakeside greenery icing up. 

Once, someone dared to touch her wings and ended up becoming an ice sculpture by the lake.

1300455.text:
Pakane can be friendly when talking about some topics she's interested in or given some tasty desserts. 

A few tricks can be of great help. It's not hard to see she is no different from a willful child. 

Even though her interest has been aroused, one can never be too careful when approaching her. Her mood, just like the weather in June, is quite changeable. 

She could be smiling one minute, then freeze anything in front of her mercilessly the next.

1300456.text:
A maiden who does not want to reveal her birth, she is said to be a noble princess from southern Elf Lakeside. 

There is also some speculation that she has elven blood flowing through her veins, which she herself denies. 

Gifted with the special ability to communicate with animals, she has been fond of seeking various animals in the Forest of Elves since her childhood. 

It's in the Forest that she met the Sacred Beast and the legend says that only a pure-hearted person can obtain the approval of that beast.

1300457.text:
She shares the same reverence for nature as the inhabitants of the Forest, and the Holy Mother she believes in is said to be Dana, the guard of the Forest. 

She is unaccustomed to greeting strangers, allegedly because she grew up in the palace, and she did not communicate much with others except for the maidservants and nobles around her. 

Her only friend is Flora from the Forest of Elves. The two of them often stroll by the lake, suggesting a close bonding.

1300458.text:
The Sacred Beast from the Forest of Elves was the ride of Dana, the Goddess of Lake. He was too proud to get close to humans, let alone be manipulated by humans. 

However, the Sacred Beast before Caledonia is totally different. He seems very close to the human Caledonia and even allows her to touch his unicorn, a symbol of his nobility. 

Under the full moon, Caledonia likes to stroke the plush fur of the Sacred Beast by the lake and snuggle up quietly up to him. 

Sometimes she will clean his fur, carefully comb him, and patiently dry any remaining dampness.

1300459.text:
Caledonia used to be not mindful of her appearance 

but since she was seen in gorgeous garments and complimented by Flora, she has started to pay heed to her dressing and even tries on the noble garments she rejected before. 

The Sacred Beast has noticed her changes and disapproves. 

Each time Caledonia is dressed up in finery, the Beast will shake his body by fits, trying to toss off Caledonia to show his discontent.

1300460.text: Cynetia used to be a nurse at the Capital Hospital of the Principality of Lunia, but got prohibited from engaging with any patient due to her character defects so only cleaning work in the hospital fell upon her. As Princess Eulalia visited the hospital, Cynetia's healing talent was discovered, and then she was asked to follow Eulalia traveling around to cure injured civilians. Out of her admiration for Eulalia, she assented gladly.

1300461.text:
She is a considerate and caring girl but has a distorted perception of pain. 

She never refuses the needs of others, to the point that it makes her dangerous. 

For patients who are suffering from pain, Cynetia adds to their psychological burden.

1300462.text:
Unlike others, Eulalia never blamed Cynetia for her eccentricity but chose to accept everything about her. 

With a simple thought that she shouldn't cause trouble for the Princess, Cynetia decided to put away the morbid part in her personality and assist Eulalia to cure the injured.

1300463.text:
She occasionally shows her true nature, even removing bandages in front of patients, then skillfully replacing them with new ones and meanwhile letting out strange laughter. 

Curiously, she enjoys high popularity among certain circles, which also perplexes Eulalia.

1300468.text:
Although as the princess she will inherit the crown of the Principality of Holmgard in the Far North, she hates life inside the castle. 

Though often reprimanded by her father for sneaking out, 

she cares little of his scoldings.

1300469.text:
Often misunderstood as a pretty face with a heart of ice, 

she actually has a naive personality, which makes her the most popular young girl in the country. 

Every time before sneaking out of the castle, she has to put on a careful disguise to avoid recognition.

1300470.text:
She enjoys sitting by the lake at night and admiring the beautiful starry sky. 

As it is written in the poems, above the bright river of stars, the North Star guiding the northern vault of heaven is the most dazzling, 

by which the people of Holmgard can navigate, and the soothsayers can foretell the future of the country.

1300471.text:
Lilia yearned for a free life, so she secretly left her hometown and embarked on a long-awaited trip. 

But she could not restrain the complex feelings of homesickness that haunted her during the journey. 

"Is there any difference between here and my hometown? The gorgeous aurora of my hometown, the stunning sight known as the Celestial Colors..."

1300472.text: A young girl was born in a small village on the border of the Kingdom of Pannonia, $B$kind and innocent.

1300473.text: She should have been playing carefree in the flower fields, $B$but the war spread to this peaceful small village, $B$so Hadal had to arm herself to guard her hometown.$B$

1300475.text: But she has never forgotten her original intention $B$that "Flower of the Battlefield" blooms only for the important things she guards.

1300476.text:
She was born into an ordinary family in the Kingdom of Pannonia 

but after the war took away her parents, she was brought up in an orphanage. 

When she fell into delusion, she always wore a strange smile, which alienated her from the other children.

1300477.text:
It is not clear what twisted her character, 

but she was craving love madly, even morbidly. 

Whatever she wants, she'll do everything in her power to get.

1300478.text:
No one came to see her off when she left the orphanage, 

but the lone girl soon made others remember her name. 

It's because her notoriety spread through the underclasses, and there is evidence that a large number of murders are somehow linked to her.

1300479.text:
But the war-torn Pannonia needed her strength. 

The ones in power wanted her to fight the intruders, and pluck out the thorns from their side. 

They decided to turn a blind eye to her morbid behavior 

and used this infamously sinful girl because anyone that becomes her target will eventually be obliterated.

1300480.text: Raised in an orphanage, $B$she was adopted at the age of five by the most powerful nobleman in the kingdom $B$and trained as an assassin along with 20 other children.

1300481.text: After hellish training, $B$only Lucia survived among the 20 children $B$and eventually became the most trusted asset of the nobles, secretly removing all their dissidents.

1300482.text: Lucia lives in the nobleman's mansion as a maid, $B$serving the masters' daily needs while protecting their safety. $B$$B$Lucia is cheerful but clumsy, $B$often tipping over or breaking her masters' things.

1300483.text: Whenever the feeble Lucia is on the verge of death, $B$her "sister" will appear to help Lucia through difficult times. $B$$B$In fact, the "sister" is her alternate personality $B$that protects herself from fear. $B$$B$Under this persona, Lucia will be transformed into a killing machine who only focuses on completing the tasks assigned to her, no matter how malicious.

1300484.text:
Cuspidata is a young girl of high standing in Fomoire. 

Though seeming timid and reluctant to look others in the eye, she is the successor of the Mad-eyes.

1300485.text:
In Fomoire, the Six Ovates are in the highest position, from six different families respectively. 

The Ovates inheriting the bloodlines of their own families all possess some marvelous power. 

Cuspidata, the Ovate in charge of the "Sùil (Eye)", has inherited the most precious legacy of the Tasius family — Mad-eyes. 

Anyone who tries to look directly into her eyes will yield to her with their minds twisted into delirium.

1300486.text:
The young girl is all alone without any friends, and everyone fears her. 

Only the doll in her hand keeps her company, which is said to be sewn by herself. She cherishes the doll very much. 

"The moonlight tonight reeks of madness." 

"That's why you don't hide from me, right?"

1300487.text:
Tasius is such a special family that all members more or less have some inhuman traits in their blood, thus all having a short lifespan. 

The awakening of inhuman traits often needs an opportunity. 

Cuspidata had a quite peaceful childhood just like others but as her younger brother suddenly got his inhuman traits awakened and went mad till death, she couldn't handle her sadness which finally awakened her inhuman traits. 

Luckily, Cuspidata has a great command of the magic so she can freely manipulate the Mad-eyes without ending up in the same dire madness as other family members.

1300488.text: Looking like an awful big sister, $B$she actually is one of the Six Ovates who enjoy the highest position on the western island of Fomoire. She inherits the bloodline of Hameln, $B$in charge of the "Cròg (Claw)".

1300489.text: People fear her more because of her hybrid appearance. $B$$B$The Hameln bloodline is mixed with wolf blood, $B$but the majority of the clan maintains a human appearance $B$and acts just like the ordinary folk do.

1300490.text:
Raphan is an exception. $B$She had awakened the blood of the beast inside of her as a toddler. $B$$B$This power soon found its usefulness, and she was worshiped as one of the Six Ovates by the people of Fomoire. $B$$B$She is given the task of guarding the island's Holy Forest, $B$mercilessly tearing to shreds any outsiders who attempt to sully its sanctity.$B$$B$
"You don't look like an intruder, $B$so can you tell Raphan why fate has guided you to this place?"

1300491.text: Raphan is also seen as an anomaly among Six Ovates. $B$The Ovates all possess unique abilities, $B$which somehow lead to the oddity of their personalities but they do have something in common, $B$that is, acting like an Ovate and keeping a distance from the ordinary folk. $B$$B$Yet Raphan is nothing like that. $B$Being reckless, greedy, and lazy, she has a terrible personality $B$and often plays tricks on others, all of which have nothing to do with an Ovate who protects this land. $B$She is really a big headache for Norn, the head of the Six Ovates.

1300492.text: From the western island of Fomoire, she is the heir of the Koshchey family, the head of the Six Ovates. $B$$B$Looking like a lively and lovely maiden, she is said to have spent hundreds of years in this world.

1300493.text:
House Koshchey, which is in charge of the "Cridhe (Heart)", is believed to be the descendants of the winged people who guarded all the living souls on earth in ancient times. 

Norn inherited an excellent lineage, able to control her appearance with magic to achieve eternal youth.

1300494.text:
What is most intimidating about her is her ability to master life and death. Her body is said to have never changed due to her immortality. 

Beings that have reached this state will become bored to the point of insanity due to seeing through the veils of this world for too many years. 

Yet Norn is different. Through the long years, she still maintains the heart of a maiden, lovingly guarding her people and constantly looking for new fun. 

"Life, life starts from the darkness." 

“Death, death ends at the Liminal Field."

1300495.text:
Lately under the influence of Miku, she has become more concerned with her appearance. 

Previously, she had never thought of changing her appearance because her body stays unchanged and there is no need for her to dress up for others. 

She has considered asking others how to dress up but as the head of the Six Ovates, she couldn't drop her pride, which has bothered her so much that she even couldn't set her mind on presiding over the sacrifice. 

She sneaked out from the ritual and hid in a corner alone with hands covering her blushing face. 

This girlish behavior was seen by Yui and recorded in her little book quietly for an unknown purpose.

1300496.text:
A village girl who grew up in the flower fields, Primula replaced her late father as an apothecary, treating the villagers' diseases and ailments. 

However, she still can't come into her own as an apothecary so she follows Tuonel to study. 

She practices hard every day, learning to identify herbs and making different potions. 

In order to determine the medicinal properties, she even tried to test the potions on herself, which is quite dangerous. 

It took a few days before Tuonel found this and stopped her from doing it again.

1300497.text:
She is convinced that she will become an apothecary like her father who alleviated the people's ailments. 

And her determination is supported by the villagers, whose encouragement strengthens her confidence in return. 

Each time she goes out to gather herbs, some villagers even cheer for her at the entrance of the village but she seems not good at responding to them.

1300498.text:
She often follows Tuonel to the wilderness, learning to recognize herbs. When tired, they lie in the endless fields of flowers, and envision their future life. 

Sometimes, she holds Tuonel's hand gentlely even without noticing it. 

She is very fond of children and often imagines what life would be like after becoming a housewife. Each time she goes to the wilderness, she will pick some flowers. The flowers will be twined into garlands and then given to the children in the village.

1300499.text:
To be a very capable housewife, she starts the practice of cooking under the guidance of the friendly villagers but due to the lack of ingredients, she doesn't make too much progress. 

Primula seems quite dissatisfied with the practice so she wants to buy more ingredients in town. 

She has to cross a plain where monsters frequent before reaching the neighboring town but being alone is quite dangerous there. Despite the grievance, she has no choice but to give up.

1300500.text: She is the hero who stood up to fight against her country's invaders. $B$She championed people from despair $B$and took the first charge against the enemy, $B$bringing glory and honor back to this land once again.

1300501.text:
"I know nothing of God's attitude toward these invaders. $B$$B$All I know is that all invaders will be expelled from our homeland and leave nothing but corpses."$B$$B$
The people were more convinced that this maiden of unknown origin was in fact an emissary of God, $B$and the soldiers who had been defeated for years regrouped under her banner of glory, $B$$B$extolling her saving grace. $B$$B$Even the prince prayed for her miracles and put all his troops under her command, $B$begging her to save the country in the name of God.

1300502.text: The maiden's banner becomes the faith of the country and the only light in the darkness. All people regard her as a Saintess, following her unswervingly and treating her victories as the Miracle.

1300503.text:
After her army supported the prince to storm the fallen capital, $B$$B$the prince knelt before her, asking her for holy grace to crown him.$B$$B$
"If I have not received holy grace, may the Lord grant it to me; $B$if I have received it, may the Lord grant it to my motherland."

1300504.text: He is an enforcer from the Sanctuary, as well as the most revered inquisitor. $B$$B$Rumor goes that he is currently wandering all around just to fulfill his vow. $B$$B$"I used to seek after truth, but now I will serve for justice".

1300505.text: Some say he is gentle as the breeze in the summer; $B$some say he is cold as the frost in the winter, $B$$B$but no one has ever seen any expression on his half-covered face.

1300506.text: He's said to be highly valued by the Protectors, $B$and it's due to the order of the Protectors that he travels around the world $B$to deal with disputes and eliminate injustice.

1300507.text: He sees his choice as justice. $B$Although he knows that the exploitation by the nobles is unfair, $B$he cannot break the oath he made to the Protectors, which causes him great agony.

1300508.text:
Czerni is said to be a noble lady from the Kingdom of Celtica but she often hangs out in the street 

and has long since abandoned the ways of the nobility, completely integrating into an ordinary life.

1300509.text:
It's said that she left the nobles' lands because of her boredom with the hedonistic life. 

Under her ladylike appearance is the strong urge to pursue danger. 

Out of her thirst for the thrill of risk, she has participated in various forms of adventures and grown deeply intoxicated by the thrill.

1300510.text:
She is convinced that her luck will lead from one victory to another and it often does. 

Though people attribute it to her somehow rigging the games, no one can see through her act. 

Accusations without any proof mutate into rumors. 

However, she still becomes the most unwanted person in all casinoes of Celtica where her portrait has been put up almost everywhere. 

No one wants to sit at the same table with her because that means the game is doomed to lose even if it hasn't started.

1300511.text:
After hearing that the ruins of Fomoire hid ancient treasures, 

she stepped into this forbidden land with one thought — 

"The ultimate pleasure I seek may exist there." 

She didn't even care a fig about the Six Ovates guarding the Fomoire, 

"The Six Ovates? Just a bunch of old fellows, can they catch up with me?"

1300512.text: `This Doll Master from the Elf Lakeside $B$seems to maintain a good relationship with the Cloistered Princess, Caledonia.

1300513.text: She doesn't like contact with outsiders $B$and is often buried deep in her house by the lake making new dolls. $B$She will do this for weeks on end.

1300514.text: She firmly believes that her puppets can handle everything for her, $B$not just simple household chores. $B$$B$Under her manipulation, $B$these carefully crafted dolls are able to perform various fine movements, $B$making people wonder if they have been given a life of their own.

1300515.text: At first, Marina just wanted a doll to complete chores for her, $B$which in a sense is a skill only slackers would develop. $B$$B$It is said among all her creations, Viola is her masterpiece. $B$After its completion, she sent Viola to a human village $B$in order to test the puppet's autonomy.

1300516.text:
As a masterpiece of Doll Master, Marina, she has strong self-awareness and the ability to learn. 

Later, she was taken to a theatrical troupe by Marina and then started to tour around with the troupe.

1300517.text:
Her delicate and flexible joints, beautiful long blond hair, 

and dancing posture quickly made her the focus of the troupe. 

Her Waltz of soulful dance steps always hit the heart of the audience 

so just a brief mentioning of Viola's Waltz was enough to make the townsfolk shell out.

1300518.text:
Unlike the other dolls, she was tired of performing day in and day out. 

Restless, she finally picked up her courage, blended into the crowd, and escaped from the troupe at the end of the show one night.

1300519.text:
Despite knowing nothing about the outside world, she wasn't worried. 

"It's okay. I possess the most powerful core." 

"I'm sure I can go further."

1300520.text:
She is a mysterious girl who appears at the fountain every time the sun sets. No one knows exactly where she came from. 

Some say she came from the Forest of Elves, and may even be one of the legendary elves. She seems scared of connecting with humans though. 

Even in stormy weather, she will appear at the fountain on time. When her song ends, the sky clears again. 

When people are surprised by such a miracle, she quietly departs, leaving behind a wanting for more...

1300521.text:
People would indulge in her beautiful songs, accompanied by the beautiful melody from her harp. Perhaps this is the so-called heavenly sound. 

It is said that she often learns new tunes from Mayahuel, who guards the Forest of Elves. 

As a High Elf, Mayahuel knows only elven music; however, Flora keeps playing new tunes that celebrate the happy life of humans. It can therefore be assumed that she has other ways of learning new songs.

1300522.text:
Mayahuel always takes good care of Flora and Mineer completely follows the orders of Flora. Both of them are not technically Flora's friends. 

Only Caledonia can be counted as her friend. 

The two often play by the lake. Sometimes Flora even wades into the water to help Caledonia groom her Sacred Beast. This is a rare moment when Flora wears a smile.

1300523.text:
It is said that she inherited the noblest elven bloodline, and even Mayahuel, who guards the Forest of Elves, uses honorific titles with her. 

Some people speculate that she is the daughter of Dana, the Goddess of Lake, but no one dares to mention this kind of topic in front of the High Elves. 

The topic about Flora's father is even regarded as taboo by Mayahuel, and once mentioned, Mayahuel's mood will sour into aggression, making those around her tremble.

1300524.text: She's the goddess worshiped by the creatures of the Elf Lakeside, and also the leader of the High Elves. $B$$B$She led the creatures of the Elf Lake to defend $B$against the invasion of the ancient demongod Gordia and $B$finally with the help of Sword Maiden of Shooting Stars, she slew the demongod to save the world.

1300525.text: It is said that Dana has been sleeping at the bottom of the Lake since then, $B$and only when her people are in grave danger, $B$will she again awaken to guard the Forest of Elves and her people. $B$$B$But someone claimed $B$that a noble lady appearing by the lake a few decades ago looked quite like $B$the legendary Goddess Dana.

1300526.text: After Dana fell into slumber, her maid, Mayahuel, $B$is given the task of guarding the Forest of Elves $B$and taking care of Flora. $B$$B$Another maid Mineer is responsible for guarding Elf Lake. $B$They perform their own duties separately but manage the Elf Lakeside together, $B$isolating the Lakeside from the outside world.

1300527.text: Flora has inherited the noblest bloodline of the High Elves. $B$From her description, it can easily tell that her mother is Dana. $B$$B$However, as to the identity of Flora's father, $B$no one dares to talk about it, which seems to be a taboo. $B$$B$Dana played the Rhythm of the Lake to lead elves and eradicate the Demongod. $B$She passed on this aria to Flora before sinking into sleep.

1300528.text:
The ruler of the Andes Tribes in the desert. 

Her beauty has conquered countless people. 

Her hardheaded ability can outmatch any man.

1300529.text:
The tribes were once divided, and fought over scarce water for many years. 

It is Ushpia who, using her thunderous abilities, led her people to sweep the entire desert and finally unified all the tribes in just a few years. 

She is eventually made ruler of all tribes.

1300530.text:
Her enemies describe her as a serpentine beauty, and even spread rumors that she poisoned the former chief of the tribe and usurped power. 

However, Ushpia herself never responds to these accusations. 

Her enemies fear her mastery of the poisonous witchcraft. 

Anyone who tries to revolt will fall victim to her.

1300531.text:
She was a slave suffering from much hardship in her early childhood. 

Therefore she is extremely wary of all people and obsessed with the pursuit of vanity. 

"Submit to me. Offer all thou hast as my belongings."

1300532.text: A young sorcerer from Andes who, $B$after bidding farewell to her master, $B$travels across the lands $B$searching for the true meaning of magic.

1300533.text: In order to practice her abilities to control magic $B$and meanwhile ward off any troubles along the way, $B$Parme floats her wand behind her, $B$declaring herself a powerful sorcerer.

1300534.text: In the course of her travels, $B$Parme met many poor people who were unable to change their fate. $B$$B$Born with a kind nature, $B$she gave all her money to them, $B$which led to her daily struggles with hunger.

1300535.text: She misses the dishes of her hometown, $B$but she is so poor that she only feeds on simple foods. $B$Still, it doesn't seem to bother her. $B$$B$Recently she has started to practice alchemy, $B$in hope of this will get her fortune and improve her life. $B$$B$However, she is a sorcerer skilled in the destructive magic $B$rather than the delicate magic $B$so the practice of alchemy always ends in failure.

1300536.text: A spiritist who appears only during the full moon. $B$She claims to have no feelings herself, $B$$B$and controls the feelings of those around her by manipulating the mask. $B$$B$She is often mistaken for a dangerous monster and kept away from others. $B$$B$Others say she never shows her feelings $B$so that no one could ever guess her real thoughts, which makes people feel intimidated.

1300537.text: Very little is written about her, $B$except that she is known as Metamorphoses, $B$$B$a shape-shifter who never leaves a trace. $B$$B$Sometimes she is seen playing with Nocturna $B$and Ella under the moonlight $B$but no one dares to approach them. $B$$B$Though they have different personalities, $B$they get along very well.

1300538.text:
No one knows exactly what she is thinking at the moment because her blank face can hardly be read. $B$$B$On the contrary, she can see through everything about the person in front of her.$B$$B$
"Let me read your soul gently and elegantly."

1300539.text: She seems indifferent to everything around $B$but Nocturna can easily sense her slight mood changes. $B$$B$Recently, Nocturna is obsessed with eating apples $B$but people in the town just run off screaming when seeing her. $B$Nocturna felt upset so she brought Metamorphoses along $B$and sneaked into the town to feast in the fruit warehouse. $B$$B$Soon, Nocturna noticed the mood swings of Metamorphoses $B$that she was apparently dissatisfied with this kind of theft. $B$Metamorphoses even wore a fierce-looking mask on the way back $B$$B$but Nocturna could care less because nothing is more important than having tasty apples.

1300540.text:
The girl with a cute look is actually a descendant of an ancient tribe, who is about to celebrate her thousandth year. 

She has been traveling around the human world for hundreds of years and thus accumulated much knowledge. 

She usually presents herself as a human, not willing to ruin her cute image. Only when she is very angry will she change back to the appearance of a dragon.

1300541.text:
She likes playing pranks and observing the funny reactions humans make afterward. 

She never complies with any human morality, and does things on her spontaneous whims. 

Due to her eccentricity, she has no friends but Nocturna and Metamorphoses who are also quite strange. 

Though strange in different ways, the three of them unexpectedly get along very well.

1300542.text:
As a dragon, Ella has survived for thousands of years but she hates people mentioning her age. 

Perhaps she has grown accustomed to human society and its vanities regarding age.

1300543.text:
She used to live a secluded life with her clan. 

When she told her parents that she wanted to leave the Dragon's Lair to the outside world, her parents were in a rage.

"The outside is dangerous and humans are malicious. They have done anything to catch all ancient clans including us. We will never approve of your leaving."

Despite her parents' repeated warnings, Ella still left the Dragon's Lair to the human world out of curiosity.

The bustling streets and the flow of people both made her excited. 

She hid her dragon form and changed into a human girl, running to the brand-new world with glee.

1300544.text: Celanya's grandfather and father are the most outstanding hunters in the village, $B$and she inherited their talents through their bloodline. $B$$B$She has started practising archery since childhood and even in the dark night, she can feel the aura of the prey. $B$It's her somatosensory system rather than her vision that plays a part in it.

1300545.text: Due to her great strength, she has absolute confidence in her archery skills. $B$She claims that "Every shot hits the bull's-eye". $B$$B$When shooting, $B$she thinks of herself as an arrow, $B$emotionless and undivided, flying straight to the target.

1300546.text: She has high self-esteem $B$and often feels empty due to a lack of anyone who can match her. $B$$B$Like her father, the Silverbow, she is eager to fight more powerful opponents. $B$$B$"If I find the legendary Fallen God, then I can both train myself $B$and find the way to make the snow and wind stop." $B$$B$With such a simple thought, $B$Celanya decided to set out alone to the mountain peak, $B$carrying her beloved longbow with her.

1300547.text:
Though she claims she is unrivaled, $B$she actually sees her father as her target. $B$$B$She had been following her father's steps $B$and imitating her father to do the hunting practice. $B$$B$But soon she found out $B$that imitation wouldn't help her to surpass her father but just leave her behind her father as always. $B$$B$After realizing this, she was kind of lost and $B$hated being weak. $B$$B$
Her father caught sight of her changes so he brought her to the target with her eyes covered. $B$"Can you feel the target?" Celanya nodded. "Then take ten steps backward. Can you still feel that?" "Ten more steps."$B$$B$
Over and over again, when Celanya removed the blindfold, she found she was a hundred steps away from the target.$B$$B$
"See, this is what you're capable of." $B$$B$Father's words are engraved in her mind. After then, she gave up the strength training but focuses on practising her archery. $B$She puts aside all distracting thoughts and works to be an emotionless archer master.

1300548.text: It sounds like a male name, $B$but it's the name of her sword. $B$$B$She refuses to give her real name to anyone.

1300549.text: She closed off her heart $B$and keeps working on her swordsmanship, $B$claiming that revenge is the only thing she lives for.

1300550.text:
She used to be the daughter of a local noble family, $B$living a carefree life. $B$$B$However, a gang of bandits broke into her home $B$and plundered her family of everything. $B$$B$
The raging fire, the horrible screams, $B$all the images before her eyes were like hell. $B$$B$She was pushed into the storage loft by her mother, $B$and huddled her tiny body inside. $B$Her terrified screams were stuck in her throat. $B$The outside was like hell $B$$B$and this poor child could only hold back her grief and let tears soak into her mouth, $B$daring not to make any sound all night. $B$$B$
In her family, she is the only one that survived this massacre.

1300551.text: In order to take revenge, $B$she wandered around, constantly pursuing the trail of the roving bandits. $B$$B$Now that she had learned that these outlaws had appeared in the forest, $B$she quit her job as a servant $B$and set out on the road $B$to revenge with her greatsword on her back.

1300552.text:
Like Kyphon, she was also a deliverer of the River of the Underworld, with the mission of guiding souls to the Underworld. 

Compared with the slacking Kyphon, Goorveig always actively completed the tasks assigned by Acheronte.

1300553.text:
·One day, she suddenly disappeared from the Underworld, and even her fellow deliverers were unaware of her whereabouts. 

Someone claimed that Goorveig had been secretly practicing some strange summoning magic. 

Living souls were reaped recently in Chilora. 

Kyphon, one of her fellow deliverers, was ordered to investigate and found that the former companion Goorveig seemed to be related to this incident.

1300554.text:
Reappearing in front of her old friend, Goorveig seemed like a totally different girl, with a drastic change in personality. 

She wore a crooked smile and licked her fingers. All the pains and evils seemed to be a source of joy for her at this moment.

1300555.text:
When she was a deliver, She didn't get along with Kyphon because she was not satisfied with Kyphon's slacking at work. 

She had complained to the ruler of the Underworld Acheronte about it many times 
but there was no reply. 

Then she decided to solve this problem by herself by making a detection device that gave an alarm to wake up Kyphon once it detected Kyphon was sleeping by the River of the Underworld. 

The two had a long-running feud with each other so upon hearing that the soul reaping incident in Chrono Tower might be related to Goorveig, 
the slack Kyphon took the unusual step of volunteering to arrest Goorveig. 

It's more like revenge than being responsible.

1300556.text: She used to set up a stall on the street and practice divination to earning a living, $B$$B$but soon came to the attention of the Senatus because of her oddly accurate divinations. $B$$B$The Senatus immediately invited her to serve them, divining political affairs and the future of the country.

1300557.text:
Hence, she became a celebrity in high society, but she missed her street life much more. 

In her eyes, the nobles are the same as ordinary folk. There is no need to give them any special treatment. 

Money and fame are mere worldly possessions.

1300558.text:
She is occasionally seen in the street taverns, exuding a noble air seemingly out of place. 

With slightly flushed cheeks, she will raise her glass and invite you to sit down, 

"Drink this and you will be intoxicated by your own destiny."

1300559.text:
Irminsul is her hometown, and what appears in Chilora seems to be only her phantom. 

It is not clear who projected her phantom into Chilora. There seems to be a deep secret lurking behind it.

1300560.text:
As the Defender of Holiness, she has inherited the purest bloodline of the Sanctuary, succeeding her older brother Garditis as the gatekeeper. 

Young as she is, she has been given the important task of expelling those outsiders who try to invade the Sanctuary. 

However, she has no sense of responsibility at all. She prefers playing with flowers and small animals to doing the tedious work. 

Therefore, she often leaves her post and sometimes even goes to the Lower Domain.

1300561.text:
Carrying a pillow around, she often lies down on the grass when tired of playing and quickly falls to sleep. 

Even so, no one dares to approach her because anyone disturbing her slumber will be identified as an intruder and be hit straight at with the pillow. 

Only her brother Garditis and sister Parfait can wake up her without being hit.

1300562.text:
She looks harmless, but in the eyes of the invaders, she is the unbreakable wall of the Sanctuary. 

Any magic attacks will be instantly absorbed by her pillow, leaving her completely unharmed. 

After that, to others' surprise, this lovely girl, will just pat her beloved pillow, and continue to enjoy an afternoon of peaceful sleep.

1300563.text:
She likes eating lemon pie, which is sour but unexpectedly gaining popularity among the nobles while her sister Parfait fond of sweet taste hates this pie so much. 

Due to the division of opinion, they fight a lot. 

Afallen decides to offer the lemon pie to the Protector and takes this opportunity to determine the orthodox status of lemon pie in the Sanctuary.

1300564.text: One of the twin gatekeepers of the Realm, Parfait always patrols the gates of the Realm in high spirits while chattering about her older dawdling sister. $B$After her brother Garditis left Sanctuary, she decided to replace him to guard the Sanctuary.

1300565.text: No one dares to intrude on the Sanctuary $B$so Parfait has a lot of leisure time. $B$She doesn't go out for fun like Afallen $B$but uses her excess psychic power to produce dessert and snacks. $B$Her snacks have never been out of stock $B$and she is quite willing to share her newly-invented snacks with others.

1300566.text: The huge dessert wand, far exceeding her height, $B$is said to emit, "a powerful magic that no barrier can resist". $B$$B$No one seems to be afraid of it $B$because the cute shape always makes people laugh.

1300567.text: If she attacks her sister's omni-absorbing pillow with the wand in her hand, what will happen? $B$It's a question without an answer. $B$$B$The two sisters seem quite close $B$and often play around in the garden of the Sanctuary. $B$$B$"Fighting is strictly forbidden!"

1300568.text:
Octavia is a young girl from the Sanctuary, but unlike the other nobles, she prefers the practice of swordplay rather than magic. 

Thus she is seen as an anomaly and thrown out of the home. 

Although rarely practicing magic, Octavia still inherits her family's magical bloodline and is able to attach the power of nature to her sword, greatly enhancing her swordplay.

1300569.text:
With her agility and dazzling swordplay, her reputation as an undefeated duelist soon spread to the upper strata of Cassiel. 

The Magical Guards there invited her to join their ranks but she promptly declined because she had no interest in anything other than improving her swordsmanship.

1300570.text:
This unbeaten Swordswoman of Squall kept challenging the strong ones and each victory has proven her strong ability. 

Yet in a duel, she lost to a girl. 

She didn't accept this until she heard the girl's name — 

Akasha, 

the name of the legendary Sword Maiden of Shooting Stars. 

Then she decided to learn swordsmanship from this heroine, for which she stayed away from the Sanctuary to live a reclusive life with her master.

1300571.text:
The encounter with Akasha has completely changed Octavia. 
Used to be a top student, yet she was rejected by her family due to her unwillingness to practice magic. 

She has won the recognition of the Upper Domain through her efforts and achievements. 

Yet, as the winning streak earned her a high position, she became arrogant and gradually forgot it's her sword that brought her glory. 

All these were seen by Akasha 

so she decided to help Octavia regain the passion for swordplay.

Their battle was started with no audience. Akasha didn't even draw her sword but Octavia soon realized the huge gap between herself and Akasha. 

"The sword has long been blunt since you ditched it."

It occurred to Octavia that each time others turned their back on her, she would train hard and wield her sword repeatedly just in hope of getting stronger.

"The streak winning has blinded me so much that I believe no one can beat me and the victory shall come easily just by wielding my sword...

But the only thing that really matters is the sword itself in my hand."

After figuring out the essence of the swordplay, she caught up with Akasha who had turned to leave and asked to be the apprentice of Akasha, restarting the practice.

"All I have now is my desire to get stronger." "

All I live for is nothing but wielding the sword."

1300572.text: No one knows exactly where this void creature came from, $B$and perhaps it can no longer even be called a creature.

1300573.text: Perhaps he was once a human, $B$but his flesh was completely devoured by the void, $B$leaving only the soul of the void behind.

1300574.text: Now, $B$he returns to the world in response to the recall of the Witch, $B$and the Witch's power helps to relieve the rampant void within him.

1300575.text: At a price, $B$he swears his loyalty to the Witch $B$and devours all the Witch's rebellious enemies, $B$ignoring their painful wails $B$and dragging their flesh into the endless void.

1300576.text:
The descendant of the Void Clan from the Space of Void appears no different from average humans. 

If anything, that may be the body size, much more petite than human's.

1300577.text:
For thousands of years, the clan has been staying in the underground tombs, 

quietly guarding the Coffin of Voidness — 

the portal between the Space of Void and other parallel worlds.

1300578.text:
Anyone who attempts to cross the Coffin of Voidness into the Space of Void will be attacked by Yurugu, who knows nothing about it except that it is a duty passed down through the centuries. 

No one could read her feelings, and no one who dared to provoke her would survive.

"I shall shower every void intruder with death equally."

1300579.text:
Recently she has developed great interests in raising a pet since she stroked a cat covered with soft hair. 

She furtively raises a cat on the border of the Space of Void and often sneaks out of the underground tomb to play with the cat. This hobby is still a secret that hasn't been discovered by others of her clan.

1300580.text:
The Sword Master who appears only in ancient records is said to be the holder of the Sword of Ego. 

With a sword skill as magnificent as stardust, she saved the world by defeating the Demongod Gordia in ancient times. 

There is nothing in the records to show her appearance. 

The public only knows she is a maiden who teamed up with Dana, the Goddess of Lake, and Acheronte, the ruler of the Underworld to defeat the Demongod. Since then, her name has never shown up in the records.

1300581.text:
Akasha is the name of the Sword of Ego and its holder often goes by the same name. 

It's believed that the Sword is injected with the will of its holder so it will never get rusty; in return, the holder will also be blessed with eternal youth. 

Thus the holder may be the same one for a thousand years. 

Some witnesses claimed to have seen the holder of Sword of Ego, but no one can be sure if she is the Sword Master who originally saved the world. 

There are also clues from children that she often lies in a field of flowers, with her clear and transparent eyes seemingly merging with the sky.

1300582.text:
Many speculated that Akasha had passed away because everything could happen during a thousand years. 

However, a maiden alleging that she is the apprentice of Akasha showed up in the Upper Domain and according to what she said, Akasha has stopped wielding the sword and lived a reclusive life, far from the uproarious world. 

This apprentice also confirmed that the maiden lying in the flower field is Akasha. 

When asked whether she could perform the same swordplay as magnificent as Akasha, 
the apprentice just waved a hand because her human body couldn't bear the burden of performing Meteor Slash. 

That's why Akasha didn't teach the apprentice her unique skill.

1300583.text:
Akasha privately is a fan of cute things though she never admits it. 

Someone witnessed that Akasha looked around in the flower field to make sure no one was around and then carefully picked up a bunny, rubbing her face against its hair. 

When spotted, Akasha straightened her face, knocked out the passer-by with incredible agility, and quickly ran away. 

The person who secretly observed this was just shocked and couldn't believe this maiden was the legendary Sword Maiden of Shooting Stars who beat the Demongod to save the world.

1300584.text: An elite sorcerer from the Veaver Academy of the Kingdom of Lochaber.

1300585.text: She is the only daughter of the oldest distinguished family in the kingdom. $B$She studies stoutly and has since become one of the top sorcerers in the kingdom.

1300586.text: Now as a teacher, $B$she instructs her students in various types of magic.

1300587.text: Always wearing a smile and teaching gently in class, $B$she is the most popular teacher at the academy.

1300588.text:
The exorcist girl from the land of the far East dresses completely differently from the inhabitants of Chilora. 

She also uses mysterious magic that is beyond the local residents' knowledge.

1300589.text:
Setting out from the distant island, 

she has subdued many demons during her journey but she never accepts gratitude from others, insisting that cleansing evil is her mission. She is often considered an eccentric for this peculiarity.

1300590.text:
Claiming to have received the will of god, she heads all the way to the end of the continent to fulfill her destiny.

All creatures that stand in her way will be considered evil and cleansed in the name of god.

It is said that Mikos can acquire the Revelation of god through the oracle, and they act according to the guidance of the god. Champion of justice is their mission that has been passed on for generations.

1300591.text:
She met Tama on her journey, who also comes from Sunrise Island.

Different from her being pious, Tama has lost the hope of life, just muddling through day by day. As a Miko, she felt obliged to get Tama back on the right track so she prayed to god for guidance.

Soon she received the revelation of god and firmly believed that. The revelation said the lost one should be taken to the west where life's meaning and future's hope both lie ahead.

Having been told this, Tama seemed to see a silver lining in her dark life and agreed to be Mikoto's companion, together heading to the west.

1300592.text:
She was born to a peasant family in an ordinary village on Sunrise Island. However, after her birth, her extraordinary psychic powers were naturally worshiped by the villagers, and she became known as the child of God.

For as long as she can remember she has never felt normal emotions, and everyone around her, including her own parents, saw her as a god.

She was so convinced of her status as a goddess that she believed that gods should have no emotions.

1300593.text:
As she aged, the reverence people had for her seemed to be a catalyst for her constantly growing power. 

Gradually, she could use the power of her mind to manipulate all things in the village. 

However, this power put a huge burden on her body. 

Finally, the girl lost control of her psychic powers. 

The uncontrolled raw power brought about the total destruction of the village, with the villagers dying in agony and their spirits corrupted.

1300594.text:
The young girl who lost her home collapsed instantly. 

She tried to muddle through by forgetting her past. She was afraid that she didn't have much time left as she felt that her body was getting weak but after a farewell to the past, maybe a new life could be led. 

With this thought in mind, the girl took a step toward her uncertain future.

1300595.text:
After leaving Sunrise Island, Tama felt even weaker and a little move could bring her discomfort. 

Thus instead of going out, she preferred to stay home, which resulted in her skin being paler. 

A rotten life like this didn't last long. She met a Miko from her homeland who was traveling in Chilora and the Miko suggested that she should set a goal of pursuing the meaning of life and with a goal, the hope will finally be restored.


The Miko's words inspired her so she decided to embark on a journey with the Miko. 

Her life may come to an end at any time but before that, she just wanted to use her tiny power to help others. This may be the meaning of life.

1300618.text: Captain of the Frost Chivalric Order

1300775.text: Hlidskjalf, Scepter of the High Seat

1300822.text: A common round shield. Lightweight and practical.

1300823.text: A shield tailored for knights. It's able to resist frontal lunge attacks.

1300824.text: A huge shield that can cover its user's entire body.

1300825.text: The shield used by the ancient Giants. Its size is beyond human imagination.

1300826.text: Given by the prophet to his people. This shield can provide shelter to sincere followers.

1300827.text: The shield given to the veteran warrior by Veronica, the Holy Empire. It represents supreme glory.

1300828.text: The shield blessed by fairies. It has incredible power.

1300829.text: The shield crystal clear as jade. Said to be made of the scales of the Chromatic Dragon from ancient times. It absorbs all kinds of magic damage.

1300830.text: The shield used in the War of Protectors. Represents law and order. It can absorb all kinds of magic damage.

1300831.text: A common bronze hammer. Easy to wield.

1300832.text: A hammer made in batch by the blacksmith. It wields certain lethal power.

1300833.text: A sledgehammer used in construction of a city. Those who are confident in their wrist strength can try to wield it.

1300834.text: A hammer commonly used by the warriors of Giants. It is a symbol of strength.

1300835.text: A sledgehammer forged by a famous craftsman. It can crush the sturdiest of bones.

1300836.text: The hammer used by the Underworld Judge. Any soul trembles at the mere sight of it.

1300837.text: The weapon used by Abadon, the founder of the Kingdom of Belgica. The earth shakes with its strikes.

1300838.text: The giant hammer used by Athenas, God of Destruction. It is capable of shattering the souls of living creatures.

1300839.text: The hammer used by the fallen Valkyrie in the Battle of the Polar Night. Conjuring endless calamities, it is cursed with the spell of Hades, conjuring endless calamities.

1300840.text: A short and protective sword that even a child can use.

1300841.text: A big sword popular among mercenaries for flexing their own strength.

1300842.text: Meticulously forged by artisans, it's exceptionally sharp.

1300843.text: A sharp sword made of a rare metal.

1300844.text: This sword can only be wielded by the valiant.

1300845.text: The sword forged from the sacred electrum by the eastern Ithacans. It has the power to purge evil.

1300846.text: A sword made of jade from the frigid lands of Snegurochka. The swing of its blade envelopes all in frost.

1300847.text: Gathering all the power of the Valkyrie Springwind, this sword successfully sealed the Dimension Demon in Lake Tirnanog.

1300848.text: The sword of souls enshrined in the Misery Palace. It carries the resentment of Sepharad, the Protector of Souls, and is said to contain the power to kill any gods.

1300850.text: A deadly axe commonly used by mercenaries.

1300851.text: An axe popular among the barbarian warriors. Looks fearsome in hand.

1300852.text: An axe used by the trolls. It is made with a simple and crude shape.

1300853.text: A timeworn axe used by veteran warriors.

1300854.text: The legendary axe filled with its forger's soul.

1300855.text: The axe that sank into the Elf Lake and absorbed the essence of the Forest of Elves.

1300856.text: A giant axe held by the God of Thunder. Able to sever any soul that is tied to this earthly realm.

1300857.text: The manifestation of Fredo, the Purgatory Dragon. Calls upon the Inferno that can burn all enemies in its path.

1300858.text: A small short blade that can be hidden in one's sleeve.

1300860.text: A lethal dagger coated with poison.

1300861.text: A dagger used by an assassin in the guise of a dancer.

1300862.text: A shining dagger that even glistens at night.

1300863.text: A cursed dagger that thirsts for souls.

1300864.text: The treasure handed down by generations of Dragonoids. It contains the mysterious power of the ancient dragon gods.

1300865.text: A dagger used to find its target even in the dark using the Curse of Blood. It is able to awaken the user's instincts for assassination.

1300866.text: The dagger used by the Protector of the Underworld, enshrined in the Misery Palace. Capable of taking the breath of life of all intruders.

1300867.text: A crudely made wooden bow that deals little damage.

1300868.text: A long hunting bow. Essential for any good hunter.

1300869.text: It can fire arrows and hit a target at great distance.

1300870.text: A highly durable bow made of the dark Giant Tree.

1300871.text: A precious item that only aristocrats are permitted to use. Beautifully decorated.

1300872.text: The huge bow used by the epic hero Hoperus who took down a dragon.

1300873.text: A magical bow that gathers the blessings of starlight.

1300874.text: An otherworldly bow summoned through evil alchemy. It is said it can destroy an entire city with a single arrow.

1300875.text: The legendary bow held by the Goddess of the Moon, who once shot down the sun out of her anger against it.

1300876.text: A book with many ruined pages. Slightly difficult to read.

1300877.text: A book with spells for apprentices to learn.

1300878.text: A book popular among Sorcerers that records commonly used spells.

1300879.text: A precious book that records advanced spells.

1300880.text: The book passed down by the sorcerer who claimed to be the most powerful in the world.

1300881.text: A book with detailed records of various forms of conjuring.

1300882.text: The sacred book passed down by generations of the Ithacan prophets in the east.

1300883.text: The Grimoire that records the highest level of dimensional magic. It is said to be left by the Chronospace Goddess of the Primeval Time.

1300884.text: The book of the supreme code that bestows infinite wisdom and magic upon its owner.

1300886.text: Musicians' favorite harp. Produces simple music.

1300887.text: This harp is often used by bards to play elegant, emotional melodies.

1300888.text: The harp handed down to future generations by a frustrated musician. It seems to speak of its former owner's grief.

1300889.text: The magical instrument used by Forest Fairies to bring happiness.

1300890.text: The instrument used by sirens to seduce crews.

1300891.text: The instrument that praises the war exploits of the Demon soldiers. It is capable of playing the sounds of Devildom.

1300892.text: Enshrined in the Misery Palace, its melody can manipulate the souls of creatures to fall into the abyss of the Underworld.

1300893.text: The artifact held by the Valkyrie, Inanna, It stimulates the potential of creatures to unlock their soul power.

1300894.text: An orb that emits no luster.

1300895.text: An orb used to gather spiritual power during the séance ceremony.

1300896.text: A transparent orb that contains incredible magic.

1300897.text: An ominous orb that sealed a demon.

1300898.text: A miraculous orb. It's believed among its followers to be able to hear the oracles.

1300900.text: The treasure passed down by generations of the ancestral tribes of the Sunfaith World. It reveals the emblem of the sun.

1300901.text: A magical orb with the power of the Auguring Star. It can reveal the future.

1300902.text: It is said to contain the sight of Uluru, the Primeval Dragon, which can lead to a future of infinite possibilities.

1300903.text: An ordinary cup made of glass.

1300904.text: It's normally used to store spiritual power which can be released in combat.

1300905.text: Carefully crafted from amethyst, it resonates with the magic inside the user's body.

1300906.text: A cup with the power to purify evil.

1300907.text: A cup that holds the healing power of Hierophants.

1300908.text: A cup filled with the water from Elf Lake. It is kind of affected by the blessing of the elves.

1300909.text: A cursed cup containing the blood of an evil dragon.

1300910.text: A magical grail that converts the holder's spiritual power into vigor. It heals any injury as long as power is supplied.

1300911.text: The artifact of the goddess Mihr that endued the power of resurrection to all things. Regarded as the origin of life.

1300912.text: An ordinary staff with nothing special.

1300913.text: A staff that foretells certain signs.

1300914.text: A staff that priests use to focus their own mana.

1300915.text: A staff that evokes lightning and thunder.

1300916.text: An evil staff with a depiction of a great eye carved on it.

1300917.text: A magical staff that gathers the power of the Morning Star.

1300918.text: The malevolent staff wielded by the King of Gaheris, used only in the rituals of demonic descent.

1300919.text: The symbolic staff for Veronica, the Holy Empire. Said to be the holy staff of the White Empress who pacified the chaos.

1300920.text: The sacred staff used in the Battle of Ashkelon. Said to be a symbol of the Sun God.

1300921.text: A common wand used for magic chanting.

1300922.text: A wand for chanting physical magic.

1300923.text: A precious wand used in summoning rituals.

1300925.text: A magic wand that chants soul-sucking magic.

1300926.text: A wand made of dragon fangs.

1300927.text: The wand that summoned the half-man monster Draupnir during the Battle of Nayd.

1300928.text: The wand that sank into Lake Aphroca in the Underworld. It can release the uroboros power of its user.

1300929.text: The staff of trials passed down in the Underworld. It is used to judge whether the souls of the dead may enter hell.

1300930.text: A leather armor that is easy to wear.

1300931.text: A common armor. Offers some protection.

1300932.text: An armor made of iron wire. Provides good defense.

1300933.text: The armor popular among knights. Strong and durable.

1300934.text: A thoroughly painted-black armor. Looks intimidating.

1300935.text: An armor only for those battle-hardened heroes.

1300936.text: An armor with a dragon pattern on it. Said to be worn by the dragon slayer.

1300937.text: Worn by the Demon soldiers from the Underworld. This armor emits an intimidating hellish aura.

1300938.text: A supreme masterpiece forged from the bones of the demigod Badoras by the elven artisan Kordaregan in the Primeval Time, as a homage to this deceased hero.

1300939.text: An ordinary garment made of cloth.

1300941.text: A robe worn only at prayer services, plain but unpretentious.

1300942.text: The daily robe of the Ovates of The Church.

1300943.text: The vestment worn by the bishops at the advent ceremony. Light and ethereal.

1300944.text: The awe-inspiring cloak of the marshal of Devildom.

1300945.text: The gown worn by the Queen of the Dragon Empire on the Island of Padora.

1300946.text: It gathers the aura of stars. Airy, elegant, and pliant.

1300947.text: The holy cloak worn by the Protector who controls the Intangible. No ordinary person can come near it, and its emanation of power can easily melt enemies' weapons.

1300948.text: An ordinary ring commonly sold at stores.

1300949.text: A ring favored by assassins. Said to be of magical protection.

1300950.text: A ring with purple jade inlay. It must command an extraordinary price.

1300951.text: A ring made of fine grains of gold.

1300952.text: The symbol of the Dark Chivalric Order of Farias. Seen by the knights as their pride.

1300953.text: The legendary magic ring that robs the wearer of their sanity.

1300954.text: A magic ring that absorbs the essence of the moonlight. The pattern of the starry sky faintly appears on it.

1300955.text: The ring worn by the half-man monster Draupnir during the Battle of Nayd. It constantly devours its wearer's soul and converts it into endless magic power.

1300956.text: A sacred object congealed from the eternal snow of the Creation Apex. Pure white and immaculate. Its wearer can go anywhere without restraint.

1300957.text: An ordinary necklace sold in markets.

1300958.text: A necklace with some magic power.

1300959.text: A silver necklace that accentuates the gentility of its wearer.

1300960.text: A necklace popular in the Southern Islands. Crafted from coral.

1300961.text: A magical necklace used to host the souls of the deceased during the advent ceremony.

1300962.text: A magic necklace favored among magicians in the far east. It is said to be able to cleanse evil and champion justice.

1300963.text: The accessory worn by Van Pelos, General Axe and the Purgatory Guard. It can summon the flames from purgatory.

1300964.text: A magical accessory. Said to be worn by the maiden who guards the Sacred Tree.

1300965.text: A sacred object dedicated by the Goddess of the Sea to the Supreme God to eulogize his act of creating the world.

1300966.text: A witch who woke up in the forest by the lake. She seems to have lost her memory.

1300968.text: Cooking, cute dresses, and everything about her sister

1300975.text:
The girl who entered the Chrono Tower with the preacher. She claims to be a champion of justice who repels monsters and evil forces. 

She can switch between the magic of different elements, but her personality may change as well. 

She looks cute and beautiful but once she starts talking, she often annoys others by making some sensational statements, especially with a superior attitude.

1300976.text:
She was an ordinary girl from the north but one day she was possessed by the metempsychosis of a priest and endowed with the power of nature that allowed her to cast all kinds of elemental spells. 

Yet this immense power made her ostracized and feared by others. 

All those negative emotions had far exceeded what a maiden of her age could bear. 

As more fears crept in, she decided to leave her homeland, away from those who hurt her before.

1300977.text:
After leaving the homeland, Anemone attracted the attention of the Church due to her immense power. 

The Church provided a shelter for her and tried to cultivate her into a tool that cleansed the heretics and taboos. 

However, her personality didn't make her a perfect match for this kind of dull and cruel work. 

In order to force her into that, the Church awakened her fire elemental power inside, which changed her personality by suppressing her weakness and gave rise to a power that far exceeded her magic. 

After the awakening, Anemone turned into a whole new person who aggressively performed the order of the Church without any thinking.

1300978.text:
Having heard people were heading to the Tower in search of the Dark Magic, the Church sent Anemone to cleanse those greedy ones. 

Yet her immense power was also a potential risk for the Church so the Preacher Fellagood was appointed to go with her into the Tower and keep a close watch on her along the way. 

Anemone never holds back her dislike to anything she finds annoying 
so she always has a fight with Dejase who is too reticent for her to get along with. 

Yet the fight itself is harmless, nothing more than thoughtless bickering. Anemone has strong self-esteem. 

Once hurt, she will vent her feelings waywardly, which is a major headache for Fellagood.

1300988.text:
She shows great loyalty to the Protector Cersivey, willing to give her all to the Protector. No one in the Chivalric Order can be as loyal as her. 

Fastidiously completing her tasks, she is regarded as a model of the chevalier.

1300989.text:
She was initially a soldier of the Frost Chivalric Order and once in a battle, her bravery was commended by the Protector Cersivey. 

Since then, Cersivey's encouraging words served as a driving force for her assiduous training. 

She always continued her training even after others had called it a day, and with her unusual perseverance, she completed many difficult challenges. 
Finally, her efforts paid off.
